verses.verse: And <WG1161> Paul <WG3972>, earnestly beholding <WG816> the council <WG4892>, said <WG2036>, Men <WG435> and brothers <WG80>, I <WG1473> have lived <WG4176> in all <WG3956> good <WG18> conscience <WG4893> before God <WG2316> until <WG891> this <WG3778> day <WG2250>.

And <WG1161> when <WG5124> he <WG846> had spoken <WG2980>, there arose <WG1096> a dissension <WG4714> between the Pharisees <WG5330> and <WG2532> the Sadducees <WG4523>: and <WG2532> the multitude <WG4128> was divided <WG4977>.

For <WG1063> the Sadducees <WG4523> <WG99999> say that <WG3004> there is <WG1511> no <WG3361> resurrection <WG386>, neither <WG3366> angel <WG32>, nor <WG3383> spirit <WG4151>: but <WG1161> the Pharisees <WG5330> confess <WG3670> both <WG297>.

And <WG1161> there arose <WG1096> a great <WG3173> cry <WG2906>: and <WG2532> the scribes <WG1122> that were of the Pharisees <WG5330>' part <WG3313> arose <WG450>, and argued <WG1264>, saying <WG3004>, We find <WG2147> no <WG3762> evil <WG2556> in <WG1722> this <WG5129> man <WG444>: but <WG1161> if <WG1487> a spirit <WG4151> or <WG2228> a angel <WG32> has spoken <WG2980> to him <WG846>, let us <WG2313> not <WG3361> fight against God <WG2313>.

And <WG1161> when there arose <WG1096> a great <WG4183> argument <WG4714>, the chief captain <WG5506>, fearing <WG2125> that <WG3361> Paul <WG3972> would be torn into pieces <WG1288> by <WG5259> them <WG846>, commanded <WG2753> the soldiers <WG4753> to go down <WG2597>, and to take <WG726> him <WG846> by force <WG726> from <WG1537> among <WG3319> them <WG846>, and <WG5037> to bring <WG71> him into <WG1519> the barracks <WG3925>.
